pr_title: implemented native SASL/JAAS support for plaintext authentication

timeline.bodyText: This list was about serde, LoginModule might go in another list (it's actually not build-in as it comes from javax.security.auth.spi.LoginModule)
timeline.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: Relocated native-SASL/JAAS code into separate build step.
replies.author: schulzp

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/extensions/kafka-client/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/kafka/client/deployment/KafkaProcessor.java b/extensions/kafka-client/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/kafka/client/deployment/KafkaProcessor.java
index 7c812ef637..34224c8b06 100644
--- a/extensions/kafka-client/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/kafka/client/deployment/KafkaProcessor.java
+++ b/extensions/kafka-client/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/kafka/client/deployment/KafkaProcessor.java

@@ -75,10 +79,7 @@ public class KafkaProcessor {
             IntegerDeserializer.class,
             ByteBufferDeserializer.class,
             StringDeserializer.class,
-            FloatDeserializer.class,
-
-            //login modules
-            LoginModule.class
+            FloatDeserializer.class
     };
 
     @BuildStep

timeline.bodyText: I would add the LoginModule directly here.
timeline.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText:
Actually, I need all the sub-classes, for example (but not limited to):

PlainLoginModule (org.apache.kafka.common.security.plain)

The list of sub-classes also contains:

ExternalCertificateLoginModule (org.apache.activemq.artemis.spi.core.security.jaas)
Krb5LoginModule (org.apache.activemq.artemis.spi.core.security.jaas)
PropertiesLoginModule (org.apache.activemq.artemis.spi.core.security.jaas)
DigestLoginModule (org.apache.zookeeper.server.auth)
LDAPLoginModule (org.apache.activemq.artemis.spi.core.security.jaas)
ScramLoginModule (org.apache.kafka.common.security.scram)
NTLoginModule (com.sun.security.auth.module)
GuestLoginModule (org.apache.activemq.artemis.spi.core.security.jaas)
InVMLoginModule (org.apache.activemq.artemis.spi.core.security.jaas)
FileLoginModule (com.sun.jmx.remote.security)
JndiLoginModule (com.sun.security.auth.module)
AbstractKeycloakLoginModule (org.keycloak.adapters.jaas)
LdapLoginModule (com.sun.security.auth.module)
OAuthBearerLoginModule (org.apache.kafka.common.security.oauthbearer)
UnixLoginModule (com.sun.security.auth.module)
Krb5LoginModule (com.sun.security.auth.module)
CertificateLoginModule (org.apache.activemq.artemis.spi.core.security.jaas)
KeyStoreLoginModule (com.sun.security.auth.module)
replies.author: schulzp

replies.bodyText: Relocated native-SASL/JAAS code into separate build step.
replies.author: schulzp

timeline.bodyText: How is this related to the issue? I may miss a link.
timeline.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: the previous @PostConstruct ran into NPEs for the @Injected KafkaRuntimeConfig. Using constructor injection it worked.
replies.author: schulzp

replies.bodyText: Why not using the static access to the configuration? That would remove the bean.
replies.author: cescoffier

timeline.bodyText:
If I understand correctly you copy the "kafka" configuration and configure the health check admin client with them.
Is it really related to this PR?
timeline.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: I'd say so. The admin client needs the same security configuration as all consumers/producers. Otherwise authentication will fail once the broker is set up to expect it.
replies.author: schulzp

replies.bodyText: Yes and no. You have applications using multiple brokers, and some parts of Quarkus use a different configuration format.
replies.author: cescoffier

timeline.bodyText: It can be confusing as the Kafka Client is not produced by default. Typically, it would not cover the configuration coming from reactive messaging. Existing applications create their properties directly (following the Kafka documentation).
timeline.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: Okay, in that case I could remove the KafkaRuntimeConfiguration again and would only have to make sure all the clients in integration-tests/kafa get the right set of properties. I just found it to be very cumbersome to inject them one by one, especially when extending the test case to more than plain authentication.
replies.author: schulzp

timeline.bodyText:
I believe we should be able to avoid this new bean.
It seems to be convenient for the tests, but the Kafka Test Resource can configure properties (that's the Map returned by the start method)
timeline.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: If we go with this, we would need to adapt the Reactive Messaging Kafka connector to use the same config. This would be a breaking change.
replies.author: cescoffier

timeline.message:
#8817 - add native SASL support

* add (native) SASL test
* runtime configuration as map
